author: yutazzz
title: Survey+Lobbying of Japanese Law
description: Não há uma pesquisa abrangente da lei japonesa e nenhuma organização para se opor a alguns dos excessos relatados do sistema legal.

f6_assessments.q0: To determine the current position of cryptographic currencies in the Japanese legal system is necessary as a basis to work towards more favorable legislation. This survey of Japanese law is therefore needed to gain a starting position by identifying threats and opportunities within the law. The proposal aims to use this starting position to start lobbying activities influencing towards favorable changes within the law. The potential impact should not be underestimated as Japan holds a large portion of long term holders.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers claim to have relevant experience in law and accounting, so they should have knowledge of the current law concerning cryptographic currencies in Japanese society. The requested budget, although set very modestly, has been broken down and accounted for in the proposal. This proposal is part of a series of proposals in Fund 7. So it is part of a larger whole, yet I would say that legality is an important part from all proposals originating from Japan to provide a framework to operate in. The team is looking to expand in the near future.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal holds the basics in terms of auditability. To further improve on that, the proposers could consider additional information of their relevant experience and some general overview on a website on how the entire project relates to the individual proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: This Proposal provides an important aspect by focusing on the Japanese community. The Proposal does very effectively address the challenge by mapping out the current situation regarding laws and legal aspects in Japan, the country where Cardano started to take form and shape. The proposer brings a profound understanding of the current situation and provides and effective solution which helps to increase Cardano's position within Japan.
f6_assessments.q1: Yuta, the proposer has been a member of the Cardano and Catalyst Community since its beginning and has an profound and very experienced understanding of the ecosystem. The proposer explains in his proposal that he is dedicated to execute the proposal even if the proposal won't be funded which again underlines his commitment and dedication. The proposer showed in previous funding rounds already that his funded proposals are well executed and implemented and appreciates by this a broad trust by the Community. The Proposal is therefore ensured to get executed.
f6_assessments.q2: The Proposer is well educated in the reporting process and regularly posts updates and relevant information on the Cardano Forum site. He reports regularly to IOG and is an overall very accountable Community Member and Proposer.

f6_assessments.q0: The survey + lobbying of Japanese law fits within the challenge of Lobbying for favourable legislation very well. As Japan community is very important to the Cardano Ecosystem, addressing the difficulty in  legislation would promote the environment nurturing for growth in 4 areas: tax law, security, FUD and DeFi.
f6_assessments.q1: Yuta-san is a Cardano ambassador who has background in tax accounting and his co-proposer, Ishikawa-San has background as a lawyer for Japanese jurisdiction. Together they are capable to steer the proposal to the success. The timeline after 6 months of funding looks plausible and promising. The budget is also in line with the study. It is very likely that the study will be carried out successfully and that some well thought out proposals will be introduced to the Japanese community.
f6_assessments.q2: The detailed plan in google docs, timeline and budget are all reasonable. They will work on the study even without funding. Very commendable for their effort! The community can also track that the money is well spent as the delivery time period is not too far in the future. With they could include risk & challenge into the proposal but it is quite clear in itself that the legislation could be the challenge!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge excellently and has potentially one of the best requested funding and potential impact ratio in this track. The fact that the results are licensed as CC BY-NC-SA will ensure an impact beyond the scope and time of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Well-experienced team for the Japanese tax law and - very important - not overcrowded with tens of different profiles, but people with specific and necessary skills. The plan is realistic, adequate, work effort understandable.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal refers to 'Feasibility section' regarding the KPI-s, but the actual information sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal is somewhat unclear.

f6_assessments.q0: As the goal of the proposal, is to comprehensively survey Japanese law + sending at least two letters of opposition to excessive legal system, the proposal fits into the challenge settings. If this approach is successful Cardano will be protected against unfavorable legislations. The problem identification is clear as seen in the "Problem statement" section.
f6_assessments.q1: From the relevant experience section, I believe the team have the skills and experience to implement the reason being that one is a Tax accountant and the other a Lawyer. It's good that links have been provided. The budget is well presented and reasonable enough for such a proposal. What is lacking are the possible risks/challenges involved in the implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has provided a time horizon for implementation of the proposal. However, the roadmap/plan is not detailed. The proposer has not included milestones. KPIs are captured in the impact section of the proposal. The solution to the targeted problem is clear is strong enough to solve it.

f6_assessments.q0: I like the idea and the focus on tax law. The team's commitment is commendable. Tax laws are used to give justification to the authoritarian government to crackdown on crypto. This project would effectively address and expose unfavorable tax laws.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is achievable but the team should commit at least one person full time to the project. The deliverables are specific and can be measured as well.
f6_assessments.q2: The team should consider giving a budget breakdown and detailed activities it would cover. Also, documentation of activities should be included.

f6_assessments.q0: The goal making letters of opposition to excessive legal systems is not a strong goal that will have immediate impact to the Japan Lagislation. However I think this is a good start, at least they can publish some researches in Japanese that is really valuable for this road in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: They have experts in Laywer. The plan is clear and the goal is realistic. They also understand about Cardano and have participated in the Expo. The best thing is that they have good attitude because they volunteer to do these thing with low wage.
f6_assessments.q2: It's easy to see if submit the oppositions as plan or not but it's hard to audit the impact to the law system in Japan. Anway it's a start, we can look forward to their next moves after that.

solution: Uma pesquisa abrangente da lei japonesa + Enviar pelo menos duas cartas de oposição a sistemas legais excessivos
experience: Yuta(Contador Público Contador Fiscal no Japão/SPO)/Ishikawa(Advogado no Japão) etc
